comment: I honestly did not learn the first thing in this class, but Grant was a good professor overall. She wanted you to do well in this class. The Daycare/PreSchool placements were a pain in the rear, but that was out of her control. She was very understanding and wanted to help in anyway she could with this situation.

Tbh I have no idea what I learned in this class because it's not a class I was interested in. Communication is a little lacking but she is sweet and caring. I would take her as a professor again but not the course.

Dr. Grant is a very nice person, but I couldn't tell you what I learned in this class. She's kind of bad about telling you about assignments, but is flexible with due dates. She is kind and wants the best for you though, and even though I felt like I didn't learn much, I would take her again. Workload is not heavy aside from the field experience.
She is ok she down plays assignments and then gives you a 50 when you did what she tells you, super nice, VERY flexible due dates

Professor Grant is an excellent teacher who is both kind and experienced in the field. She provides ample time to complete assignments, so it is important not to fall behind. However, the instructions provided can be unclear at times, which may lead to some surprise grades. She provides the opportunity to resubmit assignments. Overall, a good class

Honestly, I thought this teacher was great for the most part. She was flexible with due dates and was good at responding to messages. However, I was a bit blindsided at the end of the semester when I saw my grade. Take this as you will!

Professor Grant is a tough grader. If you take her class the feedback that she gives is ver vague. She wants you to be very specific on what everything. But doesn't explain that in anything. If you take her class, she is not going to give clear instructions on most assignments. All I can say is good luck if you take her class.
Dr.Grant gives you a lot of time to do your assignments and is understanding. She grades some assignments tough but she will always give you a chance to revise and resubmit.

This professor is very understanding and grades very reasonable. She also lets you resubmit assignments if you did something wrong. None of the assignments were too long or hard. Definitely recommend this professor.

I would take Professor Grant again. She is amazing! She understood when I couldn't come to class because of being sick all the time. She gives due dates towards the end of the semester when you finish your placement.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: The professor had a good sense of humor, although grading was somewhat challenging. However, she consistently gave clear constructive feedback and set reasonable deadlines, which is essential in education. Personally, I found their stories amusing and overall enjoyed the class (don't forget to ask to play with the parachute!).

Knows her stuff, having been a preK teacher herself. Follow the rubrics and you'll be fine. Clear about expectations and was patient to listen to me get upset about all the stressors of Block I, being overworked and sick. I really loved her.
Dr.Grant cares a lot about her course and her students. She is very kind and helpful. The class is not overwhelming at all and her expectations are clear.

Attendance is mandatory - if you miss up to three you fail the course. The coursework is overwhelming in the beginning, but it gets easier. She will thoroughly go through everything to make sure it is clear. If you need help or want her to look it over, she will. Make sure you get the textbooks, we use them a lot.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: I really enjoyed taking this class. I thought her lectures were very interesting. She is very sweet and happy to answer any questions. There is a lot of work but it's not very hard. I will say she is a slow grader. You will only need to use the textbook one time for a group project.

She's a pretty easy prof to have. The workload is a little overwhelming at the beginning but once you sit down and actually start you realize its not that bad. She lectured most classes but most students just did work for other classes at that time. Don't waste money on the textboook, didn't use it
Takes eternity to return any graded papers. Did not start grading until 2 weeks before the semester ended. She is kind, and the class is easy, but she is very unorganized.

She lets you redo the Narratives which was helpful because I didnt do good on some of them. Classes were not consistent which I did not like. She is a really nice professor and wants you to learn the material and succeed. She also lets you turn in a rough draft and a final draft of your lesson plan. She was understanding and sweet professor!

Dr. Grant is a really sweet person. With the online learning situation, due dates got really confusing and her D2L is set up in a confusing way. She emails and texts back quickly! She is a hard grader! But, she was a good professor.

Professor Grant was EXTREMELY helpful. She answered every question I had professionally and quickly. She cared about our success and gave amazing feedback. The only reason I did not give her a 5 was because there were little discrepancies in the syllabus regrading due dates. However, everyone makes mistakes. Take her!

Dr. Grant is a very sweet lady. I have taken her face to face and online. She cares about your grades and your work. I feel like she could have been more connected online than she was. But she is a great teacher. There were not any hard assignments. Easy A!

Such a sweet and caring professor! Super easy class, she knows most people take this class because they have to for elementary edu and is lenient on students. Usually dismissed class early, not lecture heavy.
She is soft spoken and does care. There are a lot of papers due to the nature of going to do observations and writing about it.

She really cares about the class and teaching. The class overall is very easy, but you must keep up with stuff on your own as you may not get reminders of upcoming assignments until its super close. The main assignments arent until the end, but I recommend doing them earlier. Shes very easy going but soft spoken and just talks the whole class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Very knowledgeable and caring. I dont really like how a few assignments are structured, particularly the child interview because of the expectation of a small child being able to answer questions like an adult. But overall kind and caring.
Dr. Grant is amazing! So knowledgeable and caring. I wish all professors were like her.

New to teaching so didn't know any of the assignments bc she didn't create them or the syllabus, however she is very nice and willing to help you succeed. You do not need the spiral LAP book bc you only use the paper one to write in and evaluate a child, so don't waste your money. Idk if you need it later on, but I never used it for this class.

GREAT about extending deadlines, She really works to help students out. The class itself wasn't hard but the detail within the assignments got to be a bit much at times. Dr. Grant walks you through everything, but because there's so much content it tends to be very overwhelming. Just reach out for help and you'll succeed.
